result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brendan D. Gerber

defendant.name: Gerber, Brendan D.

records.addlTxt: Waive reading of the information.  Defense entered NGP.  Court entered NGP on the defendant's behalf.  Set for trial, counsel will contact Judge Diehn's JA.

10:55 AM Defendant Brendan D. Gerber appeared by video.  Attorney Bryant S Plank in court for Brendan D. Gerber.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Waiver of personal appearance colloquy given by the Court, defendant agrees to appear remotely. 
Court questioned defendant on his/her understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing. Probable cause found.
Waiver of Prelim on October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Emailed Attorney Plank to schedule Waiver of Prelim Hearing; Waiting on response.

3:04 PM Defendant Brendan D. Gerber appeared by phone.  Attorney Carly Sebion appears specially for Bryant S Plank appeared by video for Brendan D. Gerber.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Plank to set for a Waiver of Prelim, call JA to set.

Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
